intro: Sanrafaelia ruffonammari, commonly known as the Crimson Moon Orchid, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It features elongated, lance-shaped leaves with a deep green hue and a velvety texture. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, violet-pink flowers that bloom during the cooler months. Its unique coloration and ornamental value make it a sought-after species among botanical enthusiasts. Due to its limited habitat and susceptibility to environmental changes, it is classified as endangered.
